29.1 Standard and slack forms This section describes two formats, standard form and slack form, that are use- ful when we specify and work with linear programs

VII: Selected Topics

Chapter 29: Linear Programming

Optimize linear function subject to linear constraints

Key Points

  • Standard form: maximize cᵀx subject to Ax ≤ b, x ≥ 0
  • Simplex algorithm: walk along edges of polytope
  • Duality: every LP has a dual LP
  • Polynomial-time algorithms exist (not simplex)

Real-World Applications

Resource allocation, scheduling, logistics
